sub_title: Water and Climate Expert on a Mission for Resilience and Sustainability | Engineer | Water-Energy-Food Nexus | Climate Change | Data Science and Analytics Enthusiast
summary:
🌊 Water Resources Expert | Climate Change Specialist | Project Manager 🌱

Hello! I'm a results-driven Water Resources Expert with 11+ years of experience in water-food-energy systems, climate change impact assessment, geospatial modeling, and water management projects. My global journey has taken me to fascinating destinations, working on initiatives that address pressing sustainability challenges.

🔭 About Me 🔭
I specialize in leveraging data, models, and new technologies for evidence-based decision-making on climate resilience and sustainable water management worldwide. Currently, I serve as a Senior Hydrologist and Climate Change Expert, also holding the role of Project Manager at FutureWater in the Netherlands. I lead international projects on flood forecasting, drought risk assessment, climate change impacts on water resources, and integrated water resources management.

💼🎓 Expertise & Impact 💼🎓
With a Ph.D. from Vrije Universiteit (VU) Amsterdam, my research focused on modeling hydroclimatic extremes, providing a strong foundation for my career. I've contributed significantly to cutting-edge climate and hydrological research at ICIMOD, Practical Action Consulting, VU, KNMI, and FutureWater. My expertise extends to water-food-energy systems, enriching my understanding of the intricate nexus between these essential resources.

🚀 Project Leadership 🚀
As a skilled Project Manager, I've led teams in developing flood forecasting systems, assessing climate change impacts on water, agriculture, energy, and water supply, and using machine learning for drought risk forecasting. My projects span diverse regions, including Nepal, Netherlands, India, Spain, Italy, Mozambique, Myanmar, China, UK, Germany, Laos, Tajikistan, and offline work in Georgia, Uzbekistan, Indonesia, and Colombia.

🌐 Global Training Experience 🌐
I take pride in being a seasoned trainer and capacity builder. Through workshops on hydrological modeling, climate risk assessment, and geospatial analysis, I've empowered professionals in Nepal, Myanmar, China, India, Mozambique, Laos, Tajikistan, and beyond to address water management and climate change challenges with innovative solutions.

🌍 Open to Collaborations 🌍
I'm excited to collaborate on projects and research that advance sustainable water management and climate resilience. If you share the vision of a greener future, let's connect and explore how we can make a meaningful impact together!
#ClimateChange #ProjectManagement #SustainableWaterManagement #WaterFoodEnergySystems #GlobalDevelopment #ClimateResilience

certifications.name: Environmental system analysis using Bayesian framework

profile_positions.description:
Key Responsibilities:
-Project Leadership: Lead and manage projects related to Water | Food | Energy | Irrigation | Hydropower | Extremes | Compound Risk | Flood | Droughts | Climate | Weather | Climate Change | River basin management | Big data | Machine learning. Take ownership of project design, implementation, and deliverables while ensuring high-quality outcomes and adherence to timelines.
-Technical Expertise: Apply extensive experience in remote sensing, agro-hydrological, and climate modeling to analyze and predict hydro-meteorological phenomena, assess climate risks (water, agriculture, energy systems), and develop adaptation strategies.
-Data and Analysis: Utilize proficiency in big data, datacube, cloud computing, geospatial data handling and analysis, and programming and derive meaningful insights for decision-making.
-Climate Resilience and Adaptation: Develop and implement climate resilience strategies for water and agricultural resources management and infrastructure projects. Provide expertise in identifying vulnerabilities, proposing adaptation measures, and conducting cost-benefit analyses.
-Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with governmental institutions, international organizations, and local partners to ensure the integration of climate resilience and sustainability measures into policies, projects, and initiatives.
-Technical Mentoring and Training: Provide guidance and support to junior staff members, colleagues, and project teams. Conduct training sessions and capacity-building activities to enhance the skills of fellow professionals.
-Report Writing and Communication: Prepare clear and comprehensive technical reports, policy briefs, and presentations to communicate project findings, recommendations, and outcomes to diverse stakeholders.
-Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in agro-hydrological modeling, climate science, adaptation strategies and enhance the knowledge base of the industry.
profile_positions.title: Senior Hydrologist/Climate Change Expert/Project Manager

profile_positions.description: -Working on key aspects related to Water | Food | Irrigation | Hydropower | Extremes | Compound Risk | Flood | Droughts | Climate | Weather | Climate Change | River basin management | Big data | Machine learning
profile_positions.title: Hydrologist

profile_positions.description:
Key Responsibilities:

Operational Probabilistic Flood Forecasting Model:
-Collaborate with DHM and project partners to test and refine the operational probabilistic flood forecasting model in the Karnali basin.
-Utilize the FloodforT toolkit to implement and validate the forecasting model, ensuring its accuracy and reliability.
-Monitor and evaluate the performance of the forecasting model, making necessary adjustments to improve its effectiveness.

Early Warning System Implementation:
-Work alongside DHM to operate and maintain the Community-Based Early Warning System in flood-prone areas.
-Ensure timely and accurate dissemination of flood forecasts, warnings, and alerts to vulnerable communities.
-Collaborate with local stakeholders to facilitate the integration of the early warning system into community resilience plans.

Capacity Building and Training:
-Support the capacity-building efforts of the Participatory Action Committee (PAC) to effectively utilize the flood forecasting model.
-Provide training and technical guidance to PAC members on the operation and interpretation of the forecasting system.
-Foster a culture of knowledge sharing and skill development to empower PAC in utilizing the model for decision-making.

Stakeholder Engagement:
-Liaise with project partners, including Zurich Global Flood Resilience Programme and Lancaster University, to ensure effective project coordination and knowledge exchange.
-Collaborate with local authorities, NGOs, and community leaders to promote awareness and understanding of the early warning system.
profile_positions.title: Hydrologist

profile_positions.description:
-Worked on key aspects related to Glacier | Snow | Floods | Hydrological modeling | Upstream-Downstream linkages | Water availability | River basins management in Hindu Kush-Himalaya region | Climate Change impacts | Hydropower |

Key Responsibilities:

Integrated Hydrological Modeling (HIMALA):
-Contribute to research efforts in assessing melt contributions from glaciers and snow-fed catchments in the HKH region.
-Analyze upstream-downstream water and food linkages, evaluating water availability for downstream users and addressing river dynamics.
-Energy balance simulation of the glaciers
-Remote sensing and geospatial analysis, assess land use land cover change in the region, climate change downscaling and bias-correction
-Develop and refine hydrological models to simulate snow and glacier melt, runoff, streamflow patterns and climate change impacts.
-Collaborate with USAID/OFDA, NASA, and other stakeholders to ensure project objectives are met.

Regional Flood Information System (HKH-HYCOS):
-Process and analyze hydro-meteorological, weather and climate data, incorporating remote sensing and geospatial information to support flood information systems.
-Contribute to the enhancement of the HYCOS database, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information for flood monitoring.
-Assess program needs and propose improvements to strengthen the utilization of weather-climate data for decision-making in South Asia.
-Provide technical support during the implementation of flood outlooks, including piloting and refinement.
-Develop training materials and conduct regional training on flood outlook development.

Koshi Basin Programme (KBP):
-Apply advanced hydrological models (J2000, GR4JSG, SWAT, SPHY) to assess water availability in the Koshi basin.
-Investigate and address structural uncertainties arising from different conceptualizations of hydrological models.
-Collaborate with stakeholders and project partners to ensure accurate and reliable water availability assessments.
profile_positions.title: Water Resources Modeller

profile_positions.description:
Key responsibilities:

Curriculum Development:
-Contribute to the development of a robust and up-to-date curriculum for climate change-related aspects.
-Design engaging course materials, lectures, assignments, and assessments that reflect the latest advancements in climate science, adaptation strategies, and disaster management techniques.
-Ensure alignment of curriculum with learning objectives, industry standards, and emerging trends in climate change research and policy.

Course Instruction and Training:
-Teach a range of courses that may include, but are not limited to:
"Impact of Climate Change on Hydropower, Transportation, and Industry Sector"
"Climate Change Induced Disasters and Management"
"Flood Risk and Hazard Mapping"
-Foster an inclusive and participatory learning environment that encourages critical thinking, open discussion, and collaborative problem-solving.
-Employ diverse teaching methodologies, including lectures, case studies, group projects, and experiential learning opportunities.

Student Engagement and Support:
-Mentor and guide students in their academic journey, providing guidance on research projects, career paths, and opportunities in the field of climate change and development.
-Offer support and feedback to enhance students' understanding and application of course concepts.
-Stay current with the latest research and developments in climate change, disaster management, and related fields.
-Contribute to scholarly activities through research publications, conference presentations, and participation in relevant academic communities.

Collaboration and Networking:
-Participate in interdisciplinary initiatives and contribute to the institution's efforts in addressing climate change and sustainable development.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Faculty at Institute of Engineering (IOE)

profile_positions.description:
Key Responsibilities:

Course Delivery:
-Plan and deliver high-quality lectures on Computational techniques in civil engineering to undergraduate students.
-Design and organize practical sessions, demonstrations, and hands-on activities to reinforce theoretical concepts.
-Foster a dynamic and interactive learning environment that encourages student engagement and participation

Student Support and Mentoring:
-Facilitate discussions and reflective exercises based on field experiences to enhance students' understanding of practical applications.
-Offer academic guidance and mentorship to students, addressing their queries, concerns, and academic challenges.
-Encourage a culture of continuous learning, critical thinking, and professional development among students.

Curriculum Enhancement:
-Collaborate with department colleagues to review and enhance the curriculum, incorporating industry trends and advancements.
-Contribute to the development of new courses, teaching methodologies, and learning resources.
